name: Clifton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Clifton Inn for a local concert and to enjoy the Charlottesville area. We stayed 2 nights at the Clifton Inn to get away from the college scene and thoroughly enjoyed our stay but felt that the prices were a bit high compared to other Relais & Chateaux properties we've visited. Free Port Wine in the room is a nice touch when first arriving.
reviews.title: Quaint, Cozy, but a tad pricey

reviews.text: While the Clifton Inn offers a very unique B&B experience some of the rooms have a bit of an awkward shower and bathroom situation which do not provide much privacy at all. This was a bit disappointing given the price which the Clifton Inn commands.
reviews.title: Nice B&B but service needs improvement

reviews.text: The service at the Clifton Inn was very helpful but a bit on the arrogant side. While we didn't have any negative run-ins with the staff, perhaps too many positive trip advisor reviews are starting to get to their heads? The Clifton Inn also claims it gets the occasional visit from Dave Matthews (musician) and other Charlottesville native celebrities which most likely contribute to the steep prices.
reviews.title: Disappointing and dull, not worth the dollars.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While staying at the Clifton Inn be sure to do so at a time when you can enjoy their calming outdoor pool and be sure to reserve your room several months in advance as this local favorite fills up quick!
reviews.title: Dreadful experience

reviews.text: We booked the fall promotion on the website of the hotel after recommendations from friends. The setting of the hotel is beautiful: large grounds with private lake, magnificent views and beautiful pool area. Downside: the service. When we arrived, the rooms weren't ready. When we were having our afternoon tea (included in the price and a treat), one of the waitresses told us there was a problem with one of the rollaway beds (the leg broke) and asked if we would mind if one of the children stayed on an inflatable matrass. As we didn't accept that, the manager came over and offered us an upgrade. So it turned out ok, but it was one of many incidents of bad service at the Clifton Inn. We ordered hot chocolate for one of the children and the servant told is that wasn't possible. Strange because the next morning at breakfast it was available. The garden rooms were we stayed at our nice but if you're not a fan of bugs, don't stay there because they enter through all the cracks in the cottages. Overall we had a pleasant stay and since we booked the fall promotion we got a good rate but at the standard rate, the Clifton Inn is overpriced for the weak service they offer.
reviews.title: Lovely Relais et Chateaux property

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in early August 2008. My husband and I were traveling with our two children (11 and 14) and booked the Thomas Jefferson and Martha Jefferson rooms, which are connecting rooms on the second floor of the main house. Both rooms were lovely, with tall ceilings and windows and a mix of antiques and reproductions. Both rooms are furnished with King Beds (the bed in the TJ room is a high four-poster), but the Martha Jefferson room is significantly larger and also has a much larger bathroom (with a separate tub and shower, the TJ room has only a shower). Ideally, my husband and I would have preferred the MJ room, but the wireless internet was nearly non-existent in that room - so we gave it to the girls (sigh) and we stayed in the other.
reviews.title: Lovely Inn - great service

likes.liked: — charm and character of the inn

reviews.text: The property is beautiful and we all enjoyed afternoons at the pool overlooking the grounds. The breakfasts (which are included in the nightly rate) were fabulous. We ate lunch there twice - good but a very limited menu and did not have dinner at the Inn at all.
reviews.title: Restful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Poor Value for the Money

likes.disliked: — Very poor value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd been driving around and sightseeing for a week so were pleasantly amazed by the retreat at Clifton. We stayed in the "Collina Farm" which is a short walk across the grounds and through the woods. Restful view of lake. Gracious, friendly staff provided tennis racquets. Pool was very refreshing and although jacuzzi jets were not working, the soaking tub was perfectly restorative. Our teens loved the historic touches. Breakfast was a luxury, as was afternoon tea overlooking the grounds. It's not that often that an historic property is so well maintained and welcoming. Good value with August special rates.
reviews.title: A wedding to remember

reviews.text: The inn is pleasant and has a professional staff, and is in a great location for visiting the local historical sites, but the rooms are greatly overpriced for the quality of the accommodations--and that's not counting the 18% service fee automatically added on. The inn serves dinner where the food is good, but in terms of quality and quantity, their dinner was the most overpriced meal of our lives, and we have traveled quite a bit in the US and Europe--and once again that's not counting the 18% gratuity that's automatically added on.
reviews.title: Outstanding - Clifton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Inn for one night in late December. The Inn was quiet and located in a lovely part of Virginia with horse farms and wineries. We booked a low cost suite in an out-building and when we return will try a different room in the main house or another building. The room was nicely furnished but reminded us of former slave quarters. The heater did not work and despite being set to above 70 degrees stayed at 54 degrees. The bathroom was "interesting". Very little space for items (make-up, curling iron, shaver) on a pedestal sink and only a single person can fit in the area at a time. The shower has a narrow opening so a sidewise entry is advised if you carry some weight. The shower was old and had layers of black mold inside. It was unappetizing for a Chateau and Relais. I'm assuming these rooms were not part of the qualification for the rating. The room is stocked with amenities(sherry & port), a fireplace (unlit), and a very nice bed.
reviews.title: Very Nice with a Caution

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome was genuine and the service was outstanding. They do allow children so be prepared for some noise. Our dinner was excellent. The menu allows you to construct a 3-5 course tasting menu in any order. The wine list is decent. Breakfast was also well-prepared and begins with homemade rolls and coffee cake. Service is attentive.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service at a Lovely Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We'd return and try a different room. The Inn is located near all the president's homes and close to Charlottesville for shopping.
reviews.title: wonderful restaurant but the grounds left a lot to be desired

reviews.text: The Clifton is a worthy member of the Relais and Chateaux network. The main house is a gracious, columned country house that has been furnished with fine post-modern furniture and done with a European flair. One is made to feel welcome upon arrival and throughout the stay. The staff seem to be well trained in the kind of service I associate with European country houses- seemingly effortless, graciousness. There were lots of "nice touches" that serve to distinguish good from excellent.
reviews.title: The best inn in Virginia
Excellent Inn...
reviews.text: Our room was one of the four less expensive "white suites" in an out building. It wasn't terribly large or luxurious in the classic sense, but rather stylish and chic in a post-modern sense with all the amenities you could ask for. Be aware that if you choose one of these suites you will share the deck with the three others. In retrospect we wish we had chosen the honeymoon cottage because it is a single unit off by itself. That said, we have no complaints about the Keswick suite in which we stayed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Clifton Inn was delightful. The staff was exceptional. They cater to your every wish. Our gourment dinner was outstanding, as were afternoon tea and breakfast. What we loved was the portion size - it was so perfect and such a pleasant change from the enormous portions at many restaurants. You could actually eat every course and not feel like you had to fast for several days . We will return.
reviews.title: A Charming Inn

reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Clifton and were quite sad to leave - everything about the stay greatly exceeded our already very high expectations. We are used to staying at top hotels like the 4 Seasons, Ritz and luxury boutiques and would rate Clifton as one of our favorites.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations

reviews.text: The reasons we feel Clifton is special are:
reviews.title: LOVED Clifton!

likes.liked: — All the personal touches--unlimited cookies, unique rooms

reviews.title: Quaint and relaxing!
reviews.text: 1. it manages to successfully combine the best of "country inn" with "european chic" - we've not run across this combination before and really think it works well at Clifton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. it has most of the modern conveniences we look for - professional operation, well trained and attentive staff, very nice facilities such as a lovely garden pool, tennis, top notch restaurant - but, never loses the charm and warmth of a Southern country estate, with uniquely decorated rooms, common mingling areas in the main house, and a very relaxed atmosphere.
reviews.title: Beautiful & Relaxing

likes.liked: — The Carriage House suite with its multiple shower heads for 2

description: Clifton, a luxury hotel member of Relais & Châteaux, puts guests in the best of both worlds with the intimacy of small inns and exquisite comforts of world-class hotels. A spectacular 100-acre setting in the shadows of the Blue Ridge Mountains. The best fine dining on the Charlottesville restaurant scene. World-class service. The list goes on and on. Clifton memories are here for the making. Consider yourself cordially invited to make some of your own.
